title: "design your board" classic serif face
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225134443im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/untitled_6162.JPG)

 [‹ Andy Warhol classic Campbell's Soup painting](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225134443/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40277 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Serif face in Dutch translation of Dante's Divine Comedy - Adobe Garamond {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225134443/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40233 "Go to next forum topic")
author: L.a.Z.

comments.content:
I think it looks like a downturned ’ear’ on the ’g’, which does not fit Garamond. My guess is [Caslon Old Face](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225134443/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/caslon-old-face/), because of the x-height. In any case, it hinges on the ’g’, because they are very similar otherwise, as far as these letters go.

- Mike Yanega
